title: The entire town for sale complete with houses, petrol station and a shop for just £3 million
text:
The entire town for sale complete with houses, petrol station and a shop for just £3 million The mostly uninhabited, unincorporated town of Tiller, Oregon, is a bargain for aspiring property moguls Share Click   Take a tour of the ENTIRE Oregon town up for sale Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Looking for a real estate investment? Got a spare £3 million? Then this might be your lucky day. 
Aspiring property moguls take note – the entire town of Tiller, Oregon, is for sale, with an asking price of just $3.5 million. 
For an extra $350,000, you can have the old school too. 
The mostly uninhabited, unincorporated town about 225 miles south of Portland originally went up for sale in 2015. Read More Inside 'London's smallest detached home' on market for first time in 50 years with eye-watering £700k price tag Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
But the original offer did not include the building that used to house the school, said Garrett Zoller, the owner of Land and Wildlife, the real estate firm selling the 250-acre (100-hectare) town. 
The current deal, at a reduced price, includes six houses and an apartment, industrial and commercial lots, and a building that once housed a gas station and general store. Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
Adding the school, on an adjacent parcel, swing sets and all, would set a buyer back about $3.85 million (£3.1 million). 
About 250 people live in the surrounding area. Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
But aside from the family that owns and is now selling the town, only two residents remain in Tiller itself - a former teacher who lives next to the school, and the pastor of the local church. Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
Neither of their parcels is for sale, Zoller said. 
The emptying out of the town came as timber harvesting declined in the region and the town’s mill closed, he said. Read More London's best commuter towns - 10 places offering the biggest bang for your buck - including a garden Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
“When the federal money started dwindling away for timber, basically the mill shut down,” Zoller said. “And when the mill shut down, a lot of the loggers started having to go away.” 
The family that owns Tiller now, he said, accumulated the town lot by lot as other families left. Tiller, Oregon is an unincorporated, centrally located rural community available for purchase (Photo: LandAndWildlife.com) 
Daydreamers aside, a complete town could also be an opportunity for a developer, Zoller said, since part of the town has already been divided for a 13-acre (5-hectare) subdivision. 
He said he had fielded calls from would-be buyers ranging from Chinese investors to people interested in starting medical facilities and hemp-growing operations. Like us on Facebook
